intro: Cassiphone marylandica, commonly known as Maryland wildflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. It is a perennial herb that produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. Cassiphone marylandica plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native habitats.
